job.description:
Site Reliability Engineer
Job Description
A client is looking for a traditional Infrastructure engineere turned DevOps engineer. They are looking for someone who can come in with knowledge of Infrastructure as Code (Ansible) along with monitoring experience (they currently use Newrelic). The best thing you can bring to the table is automation, to get code out the door, automation on the deployment process - and create a self-healing environment. They are currently using Ansible to automate.
To explain the environment everything is in AWS, they currently run everything on EC2 instances along with lambda and eventually would love to become serverless.
They are currently working on a migration from DockerSwarm to EKS and Kubernetes. At Plexus they have support from the vendor tools like K8s, Jenkins, etc. where you will be able to lean on that support if needed
Required Skills & Experience
4-5 yrs of experience in a DevOps role or 5+ years of implementing/supporting CI/CD
NewRelic or something similar
Ansible or similar
CloudFormation or Terraform
Selenium
Docker
VPC Services
Desired Skills & Experience
Aws
Redis
Kubernetes
Loggly
Tech Breakdown
Tools, not all required but this is some that they work with - AWS, Ansible, Bitbucket, Docker, Dockerswarm, Kubernetes - EKS, Jenkins, NewRelic, Loggly, Lambda, Redis - ElasticCache, VCP, Selenium etc
The Offer
Full-time Direct Hire
$105-130K + Quarterly Bonuses
You Will Receive The Following Benefits
100% company paid medical, dental and vision for Employees.
401k program with a company match and immediate vesting.
Quarterly bonuses based on company profitability.
Weekly drawings for gift cards and cash.
Paid Sick Time Leave
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis now and in the future.
